author: gstein
msg: Fix neon-.24 usage on Windows -- neon uses ssize_t which is only
declared in ne_socket.h and neon's config.h (perhaps there's a better
way to get it than including ne_socket.h everywhere?), and in session.c
there's a variable declared and initted using a non-standard style.

author: gstein
msg: The in-repos and on-disk template code needs further discussion/design and
then completion. This probably won't happen before 1.0 (and isn't really
needed for 1.0 eiter), so yank all the template stuff out for now.
* configure.in: don't bother computing the 'templatedir' subst value
(subcommand_create): pass NULL instead of the tepmlate values
(main): switch to proper name for apr_allocator_owner_set(). strip out
(svn_repos_find_root_path): return value should be const. add a note
about the return value potentially being ptr-equal to the input.
parameters in there for compatibility [for now]
(init_repos_dirs): take an additional param for the repos path. stash a
copy as repos->path. use it for computing dependent paths.
(svn_repos_create): toss template params. strip template code. update
(svn_repos_find_root_path): remove unnecessary copy of the input path.
update prototype to return a const string.

author: gstein
msg: APR recently tossed all of its deprecated APIs. We may as well switch over
to the "right" APIs now. The only *changed* interface is apr_socket_create
which we detect by looking for an old APR #define symbol.
change to the error construction; we don't need to use the createf
form since we have a simple string.
(svn_config__user_config_path): update to proper APR func names.
(make_connection): conditionally add a param to the apr_socket_create
(main): conditionally add a param to the apr_socket_create call.
(prompt): change 'prompt' argument to prevent shadowing of the function

author: philip
msg: Fix a bug tracked down by Marc Singer <elf@buici.com>.  APR configuration
sets CFLAGS and that interfered with AC_PROG_CC configuration which tests
* configure.in: Move program configuration before package configuration.

author: julianfoad
msg: Book and FAQ: update the information on using a Windows drive letter in a
"file:" URL.  Supercedes the patch in issue 1306, so closing that issue.
Replace the FAQ about working around the inability to specify a drive letter
with one that points to the section on how to do it.
Give the "Repository URLs" side bar an "id" so I can create links to it.
Correct, update and explain the examples of using a drive letter in a URL.
Replace the FAQ about working around the inability to specify a drive letter
with one that gives a brief example of how to do it and a link to the book.
